net.informaticalibera.cn1libs.wowza

Class WowzaLiveStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.informaticalibera.cn1libs.wowza.WowzaLiveStream

  • public class WowzaLiveStream
extends java.lang.Object

    Every instance of this class represents a Wowza Live Stream, that is indentified by its "name", "id" and "connection_code".

    The "name" is a descriptive name for the live stream.
    The "id" is the unique alphanumeric string that identifies the live stream.
    The "connection_code" is a six-character, alphanumeric string that allows certain encoders, including Wowza Streaming Engine and the Wowza GoCoder app, to connect with Wowza Streaming Cloud. The code can be used once and expires 24 hours after it's created.

    More info about the REST API used by this class:
    About the Wowza Streaming Cloud REST API
    Wowza Streaming Cloud REST API Reference Documentation (v1.3)

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public void create(java.lang.String name,
                   com.codename1.util.OnComplete<WowzaLiveStream> onComplete,
                   java.lang.Runnable onFail)

        (Async) Create a new live stream with the given name and using the default params; note that you can create up to 10 within 3 hours, see usage limits.

        You can use the same name for different streams, although this is not recommended.

        It throws an IllegalArgumentException if the params are not valid, according to Wowza documentation requirements about creating a new live streaming. Further documentation about params requirements is in the section Ingest parameters.

        Parameters:
        name - is a descriptive name of the stream
        onComplete - is a callback for success
        onFail - is a callback for failure

      • create

        public void create(WowzaLiveStreamParams params,
                   com.codename1.util.OnComplete<WowzaLiveStream> onComplete,
                   java.lang.Runnable onFail)

        (Async) Create a new live stream with the given params; note that you can create up to 10 within 3 hours, see usage limits.

        It throws an IllegalArgumentException if the params are not valid, according to Wowza documentation requirements about creating a new live streaming. Further documentation about params requirements is in the section Ingest parameters.

        Parameters:
        params - is a PBO with all relevant stream options
        onComplete - is a callback for success
        onFail - is a callback for failure

        Returns:

      • fetchThumbnail

        public static void fetchThumbnail(java.lang.String id,
                                  com.codename1.util.OnComplete<java.lang.String> onComplete,
                                  java.lang.Runnable onNull,
                                  java.lang.Runnable onFail)
        Fetches a thumbnail url for the given stream; the thumbnail url can be null if there is no stream data.
        Parameters:
        id - of the given stream
        onComplete - is a callback invoked if a thumbnail url was returned
        onNull - is a callback invoked if the server returned "null" as thumbnail url
        onFail - is a callback for failure

      • fetchState

        public static void fetchState(java.lang.String id,
                              com.codename1.util.OnComplete<java.lang.String> isStarted,
                              com.codename1.util.OnComplete<java.lang.String> isStopped,
                              com.codename1.util.OnComplete<java.lang.String> isStarting,
                              com.codename1.util.OnComplete<java.lang.String> isStopping,
                              com.codename1.util.OnComplete<java.lang.String> isResetting,
                              java.lang.Runnable onFail)

        (Async) Fetches the state of the given stream, providing all the possible callbacks.

        Note: Transcoding charges accrue for started live streams even if they aren't actively streaming content. Wowza Streaming Cloud automatically stops idle live streams after 20 minutes, but you should stop your stream as soon as your event ends to avoid accruing unnecessary charges.

        Parameters:
        id - of the given stream, it cannot be null
        isStarted - is a callback invoked if the state is "started", it can be null if you don't want to provide a callback for this state
        isStopped - is a callback invoked if the state is "stopped", it can be null if you don't want to provide a callback for this state
        isStarting - is a callback invoked if the state is "starting", it can be null if you don't want to provide a callback for this state
        isStopping - is a callback invoked if the state is "stopping", it can be null if you don't want to provide a callback for this state
        isResetting - is a callback invoked if the state is "resetting", it can be null if you don't want to provide a callback for this state
        onFail - is a callback for failure

      • fetchState

        public static void fetchState(java.lang.String id,
                              com.codename1.util.OnComplete<java.lang.String> isStarted,
                              com.codename1.util.OnComplete<java.lang.String> isStarting,
                              com.codename1.util.OnComplete<java.lang.String> isOtherState,
                              java.lang.Runnable onFail)

        (Async) Fetches the state of the given stream, providing a minimal set of callbacks

        Note: Transcoding charges accrue for started live streams even if they aren't actively streaming content. Wowza Streaming Cloud automatically stops idle live streams after 20 minutes, but you should stop your stream as soon as your event ends to avoid accruing unnecessary charges.

        Parameters:
        id - of the given stream; if "id" is null, it is treated as a special case that will invoke the isOtherState callback.
        isStarted - is a callback invoked if the state is "started", it can be null if you don't want to provide a callback for this state
        isStarting - is a callback invoked if the state is "starting", it can be null if you don't want to provide a callback for this state
        isOtherState - is a callback invoked if the state is neither "started" nor "stopped", it can be null if you don't want to provide a callback for this state
        onFail - is a callback for failure

      • fetchState

        public static void fetchState(java.lang.String id,
                              com.codename1.util.OnComplete<java.lang.String> isStopped,
                              com.codename1.util.OnComplete<java.lang.String> isOtherState,
                              java.lang.Runnable onFail)

        (Async) Fetches the state of the given stream, providing a minimal set of callbacks

        Note: Transcoding charges accrue for started live streams even if they aren't actively streaming content. Wowza Streaming Cloud automatically stops idle live streams after 20 minutes, but you should stop your stream as soon as your event ends to avoid accruing unnecessary charges.

        Parameters:
        id - of the given stream; if "id" is null, it is treated as a special case that will invoke the isOtherState callback.
        isStopped - is a callback invoked if the state is "stopped", it can be null if you don't want to provide a callback for this state
        isOtherState - is a callback invoked if the state is not "stopped", it can be null if you don't want to provide a callback for this state
        onFail - is a callback for failure

      • fetchConnectionState

        public static void fetchConnectionState(java.lang.String id,
                                        com.codename1.util.OnComplete<java.lang.String> isFine,
                                        com.codename1.util.OnComplete<java.lang.String> isNotFine,
                                        java.lang.Runnable onFail)

        (Async) Fetches the connection state of the given stream, providing a minimal set of callbacks

        Note: Transcoding charges accrue for started live streams even if they aren't actively streaming content. Wowza Streaming Cloud automatically stops idle live streams after 20 minutes, but you should stop your stream as soon as your event ends to avoid accruing unnecessary charges.

        Parameters:
        id - of the given stream
        isFine - is a callback invoked when the connection state is normal
        isNotFine - is a callback invoked when the connection state is warning or no_data
        onFail - is a callback for failure

      • fetchRecording

        public static void fetchRecording(java.lang.String id,
                                  com.codename1.util.OnComplete<java.lang.String> onComplete,
                                  java.lang.Runnable onFail)
        (Async) Fetches the download url of a recorded event
        Parameters:
        id - of the given recorded stream
        onComplete - is a callback for success
        onFail - is a callback for failure

      • getStreamFromPool

        public static void getStreamFromPool(int startingSize,
                                     int threshold,
                                     WowzaLiveStreamParams defaultParams,
                                     com.codename1.util.OnComplete<java.lang.String> onComplete,
                                     java.lang.Runnable onFail)

        (Async) Get a stopped stream from your pool and manage your pool accoring to the provided startingSize and threshold.

        About the performance, this methods performs sequential REST requests until it finds a stopped stream, so it can require some seconds before launching the onComplete callback.

        Parameters:
        startingSize - of your pool: if your pool size is less than your startingSize, then this method adds a new stream to the pool
        threshold - is a percentage of active streams: when the threshold is exceeded, a new stream is always added, regardless of the startingSize value
        defaultParams - can be used to customize the parameters (except the name) of the new stream that could be created, it can be null to use the default parameters
        onComplete - callback invoked on success, the passed value is the id of a stopped stream of the pool
        onFail - callback invoked on failure

      • start

        public static void start(java.lang.String id,
                         com.codename1.util.OnComplete<java.lang.String> isStarted,
                         java.lang.Runnable onFail,
                         java.lang.Integer timeout)

        (Async) Starts a stream and wait that the starting is completed before calling the callback "isStarted".

        After a default timeout of 120 seconds, if the starting is not completed then the onFail callback is called. You can customize the timeout.

        Parameters:
        id - of the stream
        isStarted - is a callback called when the starting is completed
        onFail - is a callback for failure
        timeout - (seconds) null to use the default timeout, or any other value >= 30 to set a custom timeout.

      • stop

        public static void stop(java.lang.String id,
                        com.codename1.util.OnComplete<java.lang.String> isStopped,
                        java.lang.Runnable onFail)

        (Async) Stops a stream.

        Parameters:
        id - of the stream
        isStopped - is a callback for successfull stopping
        onFail - is a callback for failure

      • setHmacAuthentication

        public static void setHmacAuthentication(boolean hmacAuthentication)
        Enables or disables the hmac authentication; by default it's disabled.
        Parameters:
        hmacAuthentication - true to enable or false to disable
